In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's an example of how you can write the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_string)
    line_length = 0
    result = ""

    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        result *= word * " "
        line_length += length(word) + 1
    end

    return result
end
```

Suppose you want to wrap the string "This is a test to wrap a string using the wrap_string function" with a maximum text width of 10:
```julia
input_string = "This is a test to wrap a string using the wrap_string function"
wrapped_string = wrap_string(input_string, 10)
println(wrapped_string)
```

The output will be:
```
This is a 
test to 
wrap a 
string 
using the 
wrap_string 
function 
```
